summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Experian Information Solutions, Inc., dated September 3, 2019, commanding the production of credit reports and related documents for unspecified individuals as part of a federal criminal investigation into violations including sex trafficking and conspiracy. The document includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: Experian Information Solutions, Inc. is commanded to appear before the grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in New York to testify and produce documents.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena to Experian for credit records related to an investigation into federal criminal violations.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Experian Information Solutions, Inc., 701 Experian Parkway, Allen, TX 75013
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official federal grand jury investigation into suspected felony violations, including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b) (coercion and enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).
The government explicitly requests Experian to voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The subpoena demands all credit reports, fraud alerts, and related documents for unspecified individuals, including account information, addresses, and credit inquiries.
The document indicates the investigation was active and ongoing as of September 2019, targeting financial records to uncover evidence related to the alleged criminal activities.
